tagline: Operational monitoring and anomaly detection for industrial automation, robotics, and manufacturing lines.
capabilities: Real-time monitoring of robot cells, conveyors, and PLC-controlled assets
Detection of cycle-time drift and throughput degradation
Correlation of telemetry across mechanical, electrical, and control signals
Early warning for equipment stress, misalignment, and control instability
Change-aware alerting during firmware updates and process reconfiguration
Fleet-wide comparison across production lines and facilities

runbooks.title: Cycle time degradation detected
steps: Compare current cycle times against historical baselines for the same product SKU
Inspect upstream and downstream stations for accumulated backpressure
Review recent firmware or parameter changes on affected robot controllers
Check mechanical wear indicators and lubrication schedules
Escalate to maintenance if degradation persists beyond acceptable thresholds

runbooks.title: PLC communication instability
steps: Verify network health between PLCs and supervisory systems
Check for recent changes to PLC logic or communication parameters
Inspect error counters and retransmission rates
Validate grounding and electromagnetic interference conditions
Switch to degraded operation mode if instability affects safety

runbooks.title: Canary deployment failure
steps: Identify affected robot cells and isolate from the main production line
Review canary performance metrics against control groups
Check compatibility between new firmware and existing PLC logic
Roll back firmware if safety or throughput is impacted
Document findings and update deployment validation criteria

faqs.q: How does LineaOps handle safety-critical systems?
faqs.a: LineaOps operates in an observational role only and does not issue control commands. Safety systems and interlocks remain authoritative within existing industrial control frameworks.

faqs.q: Can LineaOps integrate with legacy PLCs?
faqs.a: Yes. LineaOps supports common industrial protocols and can ingest telemetry from legacy PLCs through gateways without requiring intrusive changes.

faqs.q: How does LineaOps distinguish process drift from normal variability?
faqs.a: LineaOps models historical process variability and applies temporal context, allowing expected fluctuations to decay while highlighting sustained or correlated deviations.
